subject: statistics
title: T-Interval Estimation for Mean (Unknown Variance)
contentHtml: The T-interval provides a way to construct an interval estimate for the population mean when the sample variance is unknown.
problemHtml: Given a sample of size 25 with mean 10.3 and standard deviation 0.5, construct a 95% T-interval estimate for the population mean.

steps.description: Determine the degrees of freedom and confidence level
Look up the critical value from a T-distribution table or calculator

intuition: The T-interval uses the sample mean and standard deviation to create an interval that has a certain probability of containing the true population mean.

subject: statistics
title: T-Interval for Mean with Unknown Variance
contentHtml:
The T-interval is a widely used method for constructing confidence intervals (CIs) for the population mean when the sample variance is unknown.

This approach is particularly important in machine learning and AI applications where we often deal with uncertain or noisy data.
name: T-Interval for Mean
problemHtml: Suppose we want to construct a 95% CI for the population mean of exam scores with unknown variance, given a sample of size 25 and sample mean 80.

steps.explanation: We use the sample variance to estimate the unknown population variance.

intuition: The T-interval provides a way to account for uncertainty in our estimates by incorporating the sampling distribution of the mean.

subject: statistics
title: T-Interval for Mean with Unknown Variance
contentHtml: The T-interval is a widely used method for constructing confidence intervals (CI) for the mean of a population when the variance is unknown.

subject: statistics
title: T-Interval Estimation for Mean (Unknown Variance)
contentHtml: Estimating a population mean when the variance is unknown can be challenging. The T-interval provides a way to construct a confidence interval for the true mean.
name: T-Interval Formula" },
problemHtml: Suppose we want to estimate the mean weight of a population of adults, but we don't know the variance. We take a random sample of size 25 and calculate the sample mean to be 175 pounds with a sample standard deviation of 10 pounds.
explanation: We add and subtract the margin of error from the sample mean to get our confidence interval" } ],
